title: A Rural Doctor Gave Her All. Then Her Heart Broke. (Published 2022)
excerpt: Physicians suffer one of the highest burnout rates among professionals. Dr. Kimberly Becher, one of two family practitioners in Clay County, West Virginia, learned the hard way.

title: When Wall Street came to coal country: how a big-money gamble scarred Appal
excerpt: The long read: Around the turn of the millennium, hedge fund investors put an audacious bet on coal mining in the US. The bet failed – but it was the workers and the environment that paid the price

title: Serving Up West Virginia History, Not All of It Sweet (Published 2019)
excerpt: While big-name chefs take up Appalachian cooking, a farm couple are using old seeds and recipes to tell a more complex story and lift up their region.

title: This Flood-Savaged Hamlet Proves Climate Change Isn’t Just a Coastal Concern
excerpt: Nine inches of rain nearly wiped Richwood, West Virginia, off the map. As waters rise around the globe, this tiny town offers a terrifying vision of our future—if we don’t act.

title: Losing the News
excerpt: The Charleston Gazette-Mail, known for its dogged accountability journalism, survived a merger and bankruptcy. Will it survive a new owner with ties to the very industries its reporters have been watchdogging?

title: “I Don’t Want to Shoot You, Brother”
excerpt: In 2016, a West Virginia police officer came upon a young man in distress who asked the officer to shoot him. The officer didn’t. A few minutes, another officer did. Only one of them lost their job.

title: Moonshine and the Mountaineers: West Virginia's tailgate tradition
excerpt: The potent homemade whiskey is a hand-me-down through generations and a favorite of visiting fans. It's also illegal -- not that anyone cares.

title: West Virginia’s Small-Town Revival
excerpt: Remote as they seem, communities just three hours from Washington, D.C., are more than a jumping-off point for world-class outdoor adventures.
